trans-unit.source: Using the Twitter Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the Twitter Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the Twitter Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the Twitter Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the Twitter Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the Twitter Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Connect to your Twitter feed to post tweets and gets tweets from your timeline, your friends' timeline, and followers of your Twitter account.
trans-unit.target: Connect to your Twitter feed to post tweets and gets tweets from your timeline, your friends' timeline, and followers of your Twitter account.

trans-unit.source: Connectors can be used in Logic Apps to retrieve, process, or push data as a part of a "workflow".
trans-unit.target: Connectors can be used in Logic Apps to retrieve, process, or push data as a part of a "workflow".

trans-unit.source: When you use the Twitter Connector in your workflow, you can achieve a variety of scenarios.
trans-unit.target: When you use the Twitter Connector in your workflow, you can achieve a variety of scenarios.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can:
trans-unit.target: For example, you can:

trans-unit.source: Get new tweets associated with a given keyword or text.
trans-unit.target: Get new tweets associated with a given keyword or text.

trans-unit.source: When a new tweet is retrieved, it triggers a new instance of your workflow and passes the data to the next connector in your workflow.
trans-unit.target: When a new tweet is retrieved, it triggers a new instance of your workflow and passes the data to the next connector in your workflow.

trans-unit.source: For example, you create a Twitter Connector and use the New Tweet From Search trigger to monitor #peanutbutterandjelly.
trans-unit.target: For example, you create a Twitter Connector and use the New Tweet From Search trigger to monitor #peanutbutterandjelly.

trans-unit.source: Whenever there's a new tweet for #peanutbutterandjelly, your workflow (aka logic app) starts automatically.
trans-unit.target: Whenever there's a new tweet for #peanutbutterandjelly, your workflow (aka logic app) starts automatically.

trans-unit.source: Using the different actions, like "Search Tweets", you take the response and use it within your workflow.
trans-unit.target: Using the different actions, like "Search Tweets", you take the response and use it within your workflow.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can search tweets for your company name.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can search tweets for your company name.

trans-unit.source: When it's found, you can use a logic app to write this data into a SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: When it's found, you can use a logic app to write this data into a SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: Then, use the SQL Server data to determine what is being tweeted about your company.
trans-unit.target: Then, use the SQL Server data to determine what is being tweeted about your company.

trans-unit.source: Use all the operators at [Twitter Search](https://twitter.com/search).
trans-unit.target: Use all the operators at [Twitter Search](https://twitter.com/search).

trans-unit.source: Select the **operators** link.
trans-unit.target: Select the **operators** link.

trans-unit.source: The Twitter connector supports all the operators listed.
trans-unit.target: The Twitter connector supports all the operators listed.

trans-unit.source: Triggers and Actions
trans-unit.target: Triggers and Actions

trans-unit.source: *Triggers* are events that happen.
trans-unit.target: *Triggers* are events that happen.

trans-unit.source: For example, a new tweet can trigger or start a workflow or process.
trans-unit.target: For example, a new tweet can trigger or start a workflow or process.

trans-unit.source: An *Action* is the result of something.
trans-unit.target: An *Action* is the result of something.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can search for a specific tweet and when found, send an email or update a database.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can search for a specific tweet and when found, send an email or update a database.

trans-unit.source: The Twitter Connector can be used as a trigger or an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.
trans-unit.target: The Twitter Connector can be used as a trigger or an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.

trans-unit.source: The Twitter Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:
trans-unit.target: The Twitter Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:

trans-unit.source: Triggers
trans-unit.target: Triggers

trans-unit.source: Actions
trans-unit.target: Actions

trans-unit.source: New Tweet From Search
trans-unit.target: New Tweet From Search

trans-unit.source: Get User Timeline
trans-unit.target: Get User Timeline

trans-unit.source: Search Tweets
trans-unit.target: Search Tweets

trans-unit.source: Tweet
trans-unit.target: Tweet

trans-unit.source: Get Mentions Timeline
trans-unit.target: Get Mentions Timeline

trans-unit.source: Get Home Timeline
trans-unit.target: Get Home Timeline

trans-unit.source: Get Followers
trans-unit.target: Get Followers

trans-unit.source: Get Friends
trans-unit.target: Get Friends

trans-unit.source: Get User Details
trans-unit.target: Get User Details

trans-unit.source: Tweet to User
trans-unit.target: Tweet to User

trans-unit.source: Send Direct Message
trans-unit.target: Send Direct Message

trans-unit.source: The **New Tweet** trigger has been archived.
trans-unit.target: The **New Tweet** trigger has been archived.

trans-unit.source: Currently, it is still available as an Advanced operation and can be used.
trans-unit.target: Currently, it is still available as an Advanced operation and can be used.

trans-unit.source: The **Retweet** action is removed and no longer supported.
trans-unit.target: The **Retweet** action is removed and no longer supported.

trans-unit.source: If you use the Retweet action, it fails at runtime.
trans-unit.target: If you use the Retweet action, it fails at runtime.

trans-unit.source: As a result, remove the Retweet action from your logics apps.
trans-unit.target: As a result, remove the Retweet action from your logics apps.

trans-unit.source: Create the Twitter connector
trans-unit.target: Create the Twitter connector

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Creating a Twitter Connector currently requires registration of an API App with Twitter.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Creating a Twitter Connector currently requires registration of an API App with Twitter.

trans-unit.source: You can register an application for free at [http://apps.twitter.com](http://apps.twitter.com).
trans-unit.target: You can register an application for free at [http://apps.twitter.com](http://apps.twitter.com).

trans-unit.source: You will need the Twitter API Key and Secret to create a connector.
trans-unit.target: You will need the Twitter API Key and Secret to create a connector.

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: Create a free application for Twitter at [http://apps.twitter.com](http://apps.twitter.com).
trans-unit.target: Create a free application for Twitter at [http://apps.twitter.com](http://apps.twitter.com).

trans-unit.source: When registering for the app, you can put in any URL for the website, and leave the callback URL blank.
trans-unit.target: When registering for the app, you can put in any URL for the website, and leave the callback URL blank.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.

trans-unit.source: Search for “Twitter Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Search for “Twitter Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Click on 'Package Settings' and paste the 'Consumer Key' from your Twitter App into the 'clientId' field.
trans-unit.target: Click on 'Package Settings' and paste the 'Consumer Key' from your Twitter App into the 'clientId' field.

trans-unit.source: Paste the 'Consumer Secret' from your Twitter App into the 'clientSecret' field:
trans-unit.target: Paste the 'Consumer Secret' from your Twitter App into the 'clientSecret' field:

trans-unit.source: Enter other required settings around connector Name, App Service, and Resource Group.
trans-unit.target: Enter other required settings around connector Name, App Service, and Resource Group.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to further secure your Twitter API with the redirect URL, you can see details on how to do that [here](app-service-logic-oauth-security.md)
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to further secure your Twitter API with the redirect URL, you can see details on how to do that [here](app-service-logic-oauth-security.md)

trans-unit.source: Using the Twitter Connector in your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Using the Twitter Connector in your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Twitter connector as a trigger or action for your Logic Apps.
trans-unit.target: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Twitter connector as a trigger or action for your Logic Apps.

trans-unit.source: To do this:
trans-unit.target: To do this:

trans-unit.source: Create a new Logic App or open an existing Logic App:
trans-unit.target: Create a new Logic App or open an existing Logic App:

trans-unit.source: Open **Triggers and Actions** to open the Logic Apps designer:
trans-unit.target: Open **Triggers and Actions** to open the Logic Apps designer:

trans-unit.source: The Twitter connector is listed on the right hand side.
trans-unit.target: The Twitter connector is listed on the right hand side.

trans-unit.source: Select it to automatically add it to your logic app:
trans-unit.target: Select it to automatically add it to your logic app:

trans-unit.source: Select **Authorize**, enter your Twitter credentials, and select **Authorize app**:
trans-unit.target: Select **Authorize**, enter your Twitter credentials, and select **Authorize app**:

trans-unit.source: You can now configure the Twitter connector to build your workflow.
trans-unit.target: You can now configure the Twitter connector to build your workflow.

trans-unit.source: You can use the Tweets retrieved from the Twitter trigger in other actions in the flow:
trans-unit.target: You can use the Tweets retrieved from the Twitter trigger in other actions in the flow:

trans-unit.source: In the similar way, you can use the Twitter actions in your workflow.
trans-unit.target: In the similar way, you can use the Twitter actions in your workflow.

trans-unit.source: Select a Twitter action and configure the inputs for that action:
trans-unit.target: Select a Twitter action and configure the inputs for that action:

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
